website_summaries.verdict: This is a well-rounded dog dewormer solution that can easily be tailored to accommodate dogs of any size.
pros: Treats hookworms, roundworms, tapeworms and whipworms
Can be used on dogs as young as 6 weeks and as small as 10 pounds
Includes simple dosing instructions for any sized dog
Some users say it works on giardia as well
cons: A small percentage of dogs may experience vomiting or diarrhea

customer_reviews.title: Rating ZERO for price QUADRUPLING in the past six months
customer_reviews.text: Earlier this year = FEB 2019 this product, by THIS seller "Panacur" = was about $5.00 a box. Now it is $20!!!! GREED GREED GREED there is NO OTHER REASON. This product works as described but it is now ROBBERY. Others have followed suit and I believe this is due to the report by Joe Tippens. Check that out. That explains the GREED. (Joe's story isn't the problem...corporate GREED is the problem.)
customer_reviews.author: MCSE/CCNA/etc

customer_reviews.title: Might be the cure for cancer!!!??????
customer_reviews.text: I wish this tasted like cherry lol but it has no flavor. Yes I am taking this myself as I believe it can cure my cancer. I’m battling MPNST Sarcoma. You can check out my YouTube channel by searching Aaron Saettone
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Worked Like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: After the vet prescribed a useless antibiotic for my puppy's giardia, I did some research and found this. I did a six day course and within 24 hours the explosive and uncontrollable diarrhea was much better. By day six, it was completely gone. Just to be safe, I gave her another six day course 21 days later. Amazon's price is about half of what it would cost to buy locally. I'm very thankful that my pup is feeling better!
customer_reviews.author: Trinityklm

customer_reviews.title: I have been using Panacur C for years as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Panacur C for years as a breeder. It is effective with no side effects. If there are worms, this product will destroy them. Once a litter somehow had tapeworms. I had no idea until the product was administered and big long worms, some still alive, came out in their poops! It was really gross, but I was thankful for a product that did what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I have a American Akita. Upon bringing him into the vet, I was seeing live worms in my dogs poop. I took him to the vet to get a fecal flotation done. I spent over 378$ in two visits to "get rid of the worms" with no avail so I decided to worm him myself. This worked great. I put it in wet food and mixed it up, I've also sprinkled it over his kibble with a tad bit of no added salt broth and he ate it like usual and the worms were gone. I really wish I would have looked into this medication sooner before spending all that money for nothing. I would completely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: I hang out with a lot of dogs. Sometimes ...
customer_reviews.text: I hang out with a lot of dogs. Sometimes I think I should probably try Panacur. My vet said it was safe for humans! Seriously though, I know it works very well on my two dogs - they sometimes pick up roundworms or other parasites from snacking on dead things in the woods. They don't seem to mind the taste and I haven't noticed any kind of side effect. In fact, one of my dogs is prone to diarrhea and has had clean fecal tests. Taking a course of Panacur has helped to resolve her periodic GI issues so I'm guessing she's more sensitive to parasites than my other dog. It's affordable, available without a prescription, and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Ghoulia

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Danergous medication almost killed one or my dogs. Had trouble breathing and went into seizures last night. Panacur is supposedly safe at 100x the dose.. yet I gave my dog the exact amount weighed out on a scale that weighs 100ths of a gram. I followed directions to a T and still had 2 out of 3 dogs sick.
customer_reviews.author: W. K.

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, didn't work for my dog yet..
customer_reviews.text: I have done two rounds of Panacur for my miniature dachshund for giardia. Stool sample this week came back still positive, so we are going up on the dose. This stuff is pretty gross, and the powder is really annoying. it doesn't have any structure or stick to anything at all its like little ballies that just roll everywhere. I sneak this to him in balls of cheese and in between roasted chicken pieces, but its always a mess. I hate that I have to give this to him again. Round 3...
customer_reviews.author: InnocentBystander

customer_reviews.title: The best .....
customer_reviews.text: My dog was catching and eating mice so I wanted to worm her prophylacticly. Panacur has been my go to wormer for 35 years. Back when I first started using it, you could only buy it from the vet. Later it required a prescription to purchase it from a pet medication company. This is a very SAFE product and its a relief to be able to purchase it without involving a middle man. Proper vet care is important but I don't need to go see the veterinarian every time I need this.
customer_reviews.author: katchaya

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for your dog! I read it's being studied to possibly cure cancer. Check more information at Google. BUT IT'S JUST STUDIES YET!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Cancer fighting abilities...
customer_reviews.text: as you may seen on You Tube a lot of people take this product to fight cancer. I take it and have no side effects. And of course the product is ONLY for animals! (I am not a doctor or other medical profession and I would not advice anyone to take this product to cure any illnesses)
customer_reviews.author: AURorA

customer_reviews.title: Worked quickly and efficently
customer_reviews.text: This product worked effectively for both my dogs. Although I keep an eye on my boys I can't watch them 24/7 and Max will eat anything he can get his little mouth around! It worked quickly and effectively and there was no more worms with in approx 48 hours. I have a large 85 pound pup and a medium 40 pound pup and it worked for both of them. It was good value for money and saved a trip to the vet. As long as you stick to the weight to dosage ratio i don't see that this dewormer wouldn't work for anyone's pets. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kirsty Garcia

customer_reviews.title: She ate it! She likes it!
customer_reviews.text: So this is the ONLY worm killing goodness that this gosh darn animal did not immediately spit out or foam at the mouth from. That alone makes life easier. Sprinkle on food...easy peasy. Food actually eaten! What little was not eaten by Ms Picky, another finished off. I'll update once I no longer see, or if I continue to see, tapeworm segments in the bootie hair. Update: I see no evidence of tapeworm anymore. The kitten who had been treated previously for parasites by our vet now has a belly that is no longer swollen.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my husky
customer_reviews.text: This did not get rid of the tapeworms my 52lb husky had. I went to the vet after and had a fecal test done. That test came up clean but I explained that I saw worms in my dogs stool and they said that he might have a type of tape worm that’s not always detectable in the test and that this product would not clear it up. They prescribed something with a different active ingredient that started with a p. Plus side he ate the medicine no problem if I spilt it up between his meals. I had to buy a 10 lb and a 50lb dosage and did two rounds of it. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Best wormer you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm thankful for this product. I use this on my beloved pup and it has always worked well. I have used it for about a year and compared to everything else I've used this is the best stuff you can buy. I use it for prevention, but if you have worms this will kill them and rid them of the dogs body. There have never been any side effects for my dog with this wormer.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well, Unfortunately I have a dog that's obsessed with "dining" from the cats' litter pan and we recently brought in a stray with worms so the dog had to be wormed as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio Maurus

customer_reviews.title: Works. For many things
customer_reviews.text: You being someone who shouldn’t blindly take advice from an amazon review, because I don’t trust you or your situation. However, my Dog got giardia. I used this because it’s active ingredient has been proven in clinical trials (google it) to be morthe effective than the meds the vet gives and not as toxic to the liver. I Followed the dosing instructions. My dog now doesn’t have giardia. Case closed.
customer_reviews.author: BDiddyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: TWO THUMBS
customer_reviews.text: Virtually no side effects (except a little diarrhea). No worms yet so seems to be working. Also was part of my vets recommendation for clearing giardia. It’s off label I guess but it actually is effective against the Protozoa giardia. I used this, a probiotic and Kocci Free from Amber technology and my boy was free and clear without the need for antibiotics.
customer_reviews.author: BeachyKeen

customer_reviews.title: vet recommended
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended for worming cats (off label use). He said the powder does not dissolve really quickly and so the cat does not taste it as much and will eat it in food better than many wormers. This seems to be true. I work with a cat rescue and have found this very useful for ferals in particular.
customer_reviews.author: moderate user

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mix. Fast shipping. Easy on digestive system. I have 2 labs over 7yrs that love puddles and dirt. This is the same wormer my vet uses and my dogs are worm free at visits. They have had no adverse reactions to this compared to other wormers I've used. It takes care of any worms my dogs have come up against in hot, humid, dirt road, wooded deep south living.
customer_reviews.author: KoolMama

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I gave him three doses each day for 3 days (Panacur C Canine Dewormer. He Is still scratching even after the Baptist morning this medication did not work there's another twelve dollars down the drain I don't know what else to get this medication did not work I mixed it in with attitude the last dose the first two doses I put it in some cream cheese he ate it without any problem it might work for other dogs but it did not work for mine
customer_reviews.author: W. M. TYLER

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well and was glad to find it with such great reviews. Through a few different ways I realized this was likely the issue with our 8 yr old pug who had persistent diarrhea and was beginning to lose weight. Day 1 and 2 showed no improvement but on day 3 it was clear that worms were the issue as he had passed a huge amount of worms in his feces. That same day our little buddy was showing much better mood and energy. He began gaining weight within days and now a month later he is like a 2 yr old pup again. I definitely recommend this if you can determine you need a dewormer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My picky dog ate it and I think it's priced great
customer_reviews.text: I suspected my dog had giardia so we ordered this. I just finished up the last treatment today so it's hard to say if this worked yet or not but she ate it just fine when sprinkled on top of her regular dog food moistened with water. Either way I'm happy with this product because it's a great precaution to use every 6mon.
customer_reviews.author: Aletheia Backs

customer_reviews.title: No more worms!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews we went with this over the competitors. Three dosages. Worms gone! Very important to figure the dosages correctly and the way the product is sold you may end up with a couple of extra packets. Other than that it got the job done!!!
customer_reviews.author: Project Master

customer_reviews.title: Well, it works
customer_reviews.text: My dog threw up a worm on my floor. It was disgusting. I bought the panacur on the recommendation of my wife-in-law, who works in a vet clinic. This did work, but my picky eater was not having the change in flavor/texture/color of his kibble. I added extra pumpkin and a little chicken and cheese. He ate more, but still didn't finish all of it. He also won't eat the sentinel, I have to hide that in his food or some cheese. He's a pain, but is cheerfully worm free.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: One good, the other bad
customer_reviews.text: One dog did fine but the other was emitting from both ends from just one dose. I just couldn't continue with the doses on the poor guy. Three days later he's back to normal but many, many, many trips to the back yard. I'm sure it's a fine product but it just didn't fit with us.
customer_reviews.author: coconut nut

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful!
customer_reviews.text: I worked for a vet and I know how important deworming is. I’ve got a pup right now that suffered from all kinds of ailments, including needing dewormed when we got him. Panacur is always the go to. It works fabulous and I’ve never had any sort of problem. We also use a dog day care, so he’s in contact with many other dogs on a regular basis. So I stick to using panacur every 4 months to keep him worm free. It’s honestly the only brand I’ll use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Effective and my dog eats it without issue !
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my breeder and vet for de-working . Note this is not a preventive - but If your dog has worms it will get rid of them . Best part is I don’t need to do any special tricks to get my dog to take it - just sprinkle on her food and she eats it !
customer_reviews.author: flexiest

customer_reviews.title: Misleading when it claims to get rid of tapeworms.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased, without consulting my vet, to use on a canine with tape worms. It did not work. After consulting my vet, I was told Panacur used to work on Tapeworms but does not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Never know until you try it this worked good
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this product because of some of the reviews stating that it did not work. But you never know until you tried yourself! This works really good. I gave it to the dog 3 days in a row and I mixed it in with wet food and dry food so that way he would eat it. It is a powder substance and it was a little hard to mix it up in the wet food but it all worked out by the third day he was clean with no more worms in his poop.
customer_reviews.author: Celina The Stylist Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Used this instead of going to the vet
customer_reviews.text: Used this to deworm our dogs and a new puppy we had. We just did it as a preventative (also Panacur costs a lot of money at our vet!) If your dog has worms though, always go through your vet first to make sure everything is okay before self medicating your dog(s). Since we have gotten Panacur from our vet before, we knew it was safe to give. Works like a charm and saved us money.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kao

customer_reviews.title: Dogs hate taste
customer_reviews.text: Dogs would NOT eat their food with this in it. It’s hard to dose it accurately too if your dog is not 20 or 40 lbs (or just increments of 20). I just don’t think this is worth it since it cannot kill worms if my dogs won’t consume it no matter what I put it in. I ended up having to order another dewormer but got it in tablet form and dogs ate those and they worked.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harbin

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works wonders on my Golden Retriever. It did leave him not feeling too good for a day, while it did its thing; but, after that he perked right back up and ditched three different kinds of worms in his feces. I'd say it did good work!
customer_reviews.author: Education Matters

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My Rottweiler breeder recommended these for my 4 month old champ. Mixes easily and dog ate without a problem. A small food scale is needed to get exact dosage unless your dog weighs exactly 40 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Thebigbluecesar

customer_reviews.title: ... be a necessary evil for dogs because it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I consider Panacur to be a necessary evil for dogs because it works like a charm, but every dog I've had completely loses their appetite by the second dose and cannot take the third dose. Thankfully two doses have always been enough to knock out parasites in our experience, but then it takes two weeks or more of refusing to eat almost anything before they're back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. If you ask a vet or look up the dosages, you can use it for your cats and it costs less than buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Gremmy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Absolutely the only dog wormer that works! Great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Thank God for a product that works! Other products fail to work. My vet said this is currently the one product they use. The vet told me that for some reason other products have stopped working, why? She couldn't say other than they may have changed the formula? Until I found this product my Sholie's had worms. My dogs had worms until they were six months old as a result of the failure of other products we bought at the farm and feed store.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Baker

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it does and it did it ahead of schedule. Just be sure to pick up their poo, as always. Was so glad to see his condition start improving immediately after treating him with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wes McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my vet
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommened for not only worms but giardia as well. I use once or twice a year since it's so common and it seems to do the trick. Dinged one star for taste. This stuff must taste terrible because neither of my dogs will touch it blended in with their normal food. I have to skip a feeding to make them very hungry and blend it in with some special mouth watering food for them to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Nomen Nescio

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for years on my dog. I worm him at least once a year, sometimes twice depending on possible exposure. My dog has zero issue eating it in his food. It does what it's supposed to do. His fecal tests always come back positive after this treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Andie R.

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my dog protected
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works!!! I purchase this for my dogs (both around 50lbs) to get rid of and to prevent worms. Since I live on a farm surrounded by cows and other livestock that comes from who knows where, they get worms now and again, but this stuff takes care of it within days if not hours. They have never had any issue with this product, just mix it with some moist dog food and they eat it right up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Giardia is gone.  Worms are gone.  Pound puppy so much happier!
customer_reviews.text: Updating quite a bit later. In the spring, the silly dog snaps at (and catches) flies/mosquitoes/etc. Gets a bit wormy. 1 1/2 packets for 3 days? Not wormy. When we brought him home from the pound, he had giardia. Worked for that, too. Giardia is gone. One pack dissolved in 1/2 can of wet dog food 2x a day for dog over 50#. EVERYONE is happier, particularly the dog we adopted from the pound.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoran Skies

customer_reviews.title: It works but price gouging
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. But price has doubled in 2 yrs, and increased a further 25% since I last checked 2 days ago. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: It works and I bought it
customer_reviews.text: but the box looked like some dog chewed it (yeah seriously!) I kept it because the packs inside were not beat up and still within expiration date. Plus it was a NEED to buy at the time. This is a great product but yeah Amazon, do a better job to not let the boxes get beat up?
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Pot Pie

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than it used to be
customer_reviews.text: Chalky. Just needed it for the fenbendazole but it's more expensive than it used to be. Is the part I dont like. And of course the fact that it doesnt work on actually ALL parasites. But well see in time..
customer_reviews.author: cotton

customer_reviews.title: Did not cure dog’s metastisized mammary cancer.
customer_reviews.text: Needed miracle cancer cure for dog, but it failed. Gave 1 gram panacure c every day but 4th day had to put dog down. Joe Tippen cure not working on dog. BEWARE of bogus youtube testimonials. BS!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My dog passed a tape worm prior so I put her on the packs to make sure everything is dead and passed. Hasn’t scooted or bothered her bum since. Great product, great price. Can’t go wrong compared to a vet visit and medication costs compared to the clinic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this product really works very well to get rid of most parasites! It was easy to administer just mix it in with soft food and it does it's thing. It treats a variety of parasites namely Giardia which can wreak havoc on your dog's system. Believe me I know!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Starroff

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazingly! saved me a expensive vet trip!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has worms in his vomit, he is still a puppy so I expected that he had birth worms as most puppies do. This stuff works as directed and got all of them out when he went to the bathroom. Saved me a trip to the dr and a large de worming bill. Just don’t overdose your dog and don’t buy a big dog dose for your small dog and you’ll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great product and really great price
customer_reviews.text: We had just brought our little rescue beagle home, and discovered worms, yuck! Three doses of this as instructed and no more worms. Just mixed it with her dry food and a little bit of water to make it stick to the kibble. She didn't even hesitate on eating it. No side effects noted. Great product and really great price.
customer_reviews.author: Charlyn Wherry

customer_reviews.title: Effective and timely
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and effective. Three days of one dose daily and worms are gone. Panacur covers a wider range of worm infestations. It's really the best in my opinion. I just sprinkle in the dogs canned food and they don't even know it's in there.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Best product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for many years...on many different dogs. When I discovered that this was the exact brand that my vet used, I also discovered that it was cheaper without having a vet appt. Easy to use. Dogs eat with little issues. Seems to clean them out properly. Will always continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Keifers

customer_reviews.title: Dewormed!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for deworming. Our family includes Mastiff’s, Yorkie’s, and a Husky.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Great that you can still get this mail order!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, fast shipping! If your pet has Giardia, be sure to concurrently bathe him/her with a Chlorhexidine 4% antiseptic skin cleanser (CVS makes a generic and HibiCleanse is a brand name) and follow the directions leaving it on the fur & skin for 15 min. (It's tough to get around the mouth because they will try to lick, --try to prevent that-- but that's an important area to get clean)
customer_reviews.author: Time's Up

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my brother's dog
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my brother's dog. There are only two dewormers that I know of that knock out everything & this is one of them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T Anthony

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: It was suggested to us for our new puppy after her fecal test came back showing signs of worms. It was tolerated well by our puppy and it worked. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of my dogs Giardia
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of my dogs Giardia without having to pay hundreds of dollars of vet bills. I gave them five doses five days in a row and then waited 21 days and gave them another bout of doses and they were cured
customer_reviews.author: Jules78

customer_reviews.title: Great Vet Alternative
customer_reviews.text: My love tested positive for Giardia and was treated with Panacur from the vet, a white liquid. The med did work but a couple months later my loves stool was soft and greasy looking. I decided to try this product due to it being slightly cheaper than the vets and way easier to administer. I just mixed it with some pumpkin with no problems. Had her stool retested and all is well. I then changed our walk route and no more Giardia infections.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to administer, Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have four dogs and while they rarely get intestinal worms, it is not unheard of. It is really handy to be able to order this on line instead of having to make a visit to the vet. It works great. You just have to follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Dewormed my dog. Not much more to say...want me to make this a photo review?
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to administer to my dog. She's 40 lbs; I used 3 pkgs of the worming powder over 3 days time by mixing with her dry dog chow and water. She consumed all of it, no problem. Recommend and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: C.D.

customer_reviews.title: Treated my pups worms at home
customer_reviews.text: Saw a difference in her poop in 2 days. This beat the giant vet bill!
customer_reviews.author: MaebeBoots

customer_reviews.title: Product works! And my dog took it just fine
customer_reviews.text: Well my dog ate it with his food and didnt seem to mind. (He is very picky) got rid of the worms
customer_reviews.author: Shyla

customer_reviews.title: Great relief for Giardia infection
customer_reviews.text: My Boston Terrier was having a hard time with diarrhea for few weeks. Vet could not find anything in stool sample. After trying hookworm medication, tried this. In about 5 days he recovered. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Rafumed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for daughters dog and it killed the tape works in a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kenney

customer_reviews.title: ) Seems to wipe out the worms each time and it is easy to administer
customer_reviews.text: Have used this on the dogs for several years (2x a year.) Seems to wipe out the worms each time and it is easy to administer...of course the worms come back (dogs eat everything they can outside.) I have 2 dobermans and they think they are Goats.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Hooray  it works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great our vet prescribed a previous medication which did not work for Giardia. Our puppy had a bad case of it and after a round of Panacur*C it finally went away. Would recommend this to everyone our neighbor even uses it on his birds.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: a healthy buy for both you and your pet
customer_reviews.text: I use panacur c to worm my dogs every few months since people can pick up some of the same parasites form them. Better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Granny123go

customer_reviews.title: Cured giardia, tastes good tondogs
customer_reviews.text: Vet says this cured my GSD of giardia. We plan to treat proactively maybe 2 to 3 times a year, living in a cold damp place makes giardia a regular threat.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Hookwormer killer!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have worked for the constant hookworms we were not able to get rid of prior
customer_reviews.author: K.Zaruba

customer_reviews.title: Works every time.
customer_reviews.text: This works every time my dog gets worms. WAY cheaper then going in to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: MBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Skipped the Vet
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second round of this to clear up my puppy's giardia and Amazon saved me the vet visit. Mix with a bit of wet food and it's easy to give to your dog. This is a 3 day course of treatment for one 40 lbs dog.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked on my dog, as far as I can tell, it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: deborahflorez

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR DIY PEOPLE
customer_reviews.text: THIS DID THE JOB ON MY 54 LB LAB. FOLLOWED DIRECTIONS. CHEAPER THAN THE VET AND DIDN'T INVOLVE A TRIP TO THE VET.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came super fast!
customer_reviews.text: It came super fast. Moreover, it is tasteless, so it doesn't make the cats stay away from foods. Hope it will work in eliminating Gardia.
customer_reviews.author: mekur xr4ti ln

customer_reviews.title: Worked!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great! Helped cure our puppy from Giardia. Vet had given him some other medicine which didn't work. After months of going back and forth with the vet, we tried Panacure and our pup finally got relief. Thank goodness!
customer_reviews.author: K. Crannell

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Brand Because It Works So Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Panacur C will annihilate any worms your fuzzy friends may have. Worked within the first 2 days of giving them to my two black labs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sulzbach

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to find this on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Former vet assistant. Needed to deworm my dog after he returned from the boarding kennel with loose stools. He gets Heartguard+ each month but it doesn't kill everything. Panacur covers what HG+ doesn't and it is effective and safe. Very happy to find this on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Kail Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to administer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to administer with food. Gave this as a supplementary to the regular Interceptor. Dosing could be made a bit simpler instead of having to buy different sizes of packages. My German Shepherd ate it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: GSD's for life

customer_reviews.title: Wormer
customer_reviews.text: This works for Giardia. The vet recommends this to treat the symptoms, along with metronidazole to kill the infection, but this this the cheapest way to purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Worked but individually packaged dosages sucked
customer_reviews.text: Worked but didn't care for the packets. I had to treat 3 dogs, each a different size and I would have preferred to measure out the correct amount myself.

customer_reviews.title: Saved Lots of Money! Dog is Parasite Free
customer_reviews.text: I was so relieved to find this product on Amazon. My vet wanted to charge me $75 for the same medication! The price was incredible and the shipping was fast! Product proved to be very effective and my dog is parasite free! I'm a happy customer and have shared this with all my dog loving friends. Thank you😀

customer_reviews.title: works great, no need to get from the vet if you understand symptoms of worms
customer_reviews.text: Skip a trip to the vet! I work on a farm and my dog gets worms from the horses every once and a while. If you have experience with the issue and know the signs, this is an awesome alternative to a 120$ vet bill.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent de-wormer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product worked very well on my dogs. There were no nasty side-effects like vomiting and diarrhea. However, I would advise you put the powder in canned dog food and mix it well.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great - I use it for the Joe Tippens protocol and have been happy with the results.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This worked wonders for us. My Aussie picked up roundworms from the dog park and i bought this and got it in 2 days with Prime. I sprinkled it in his food and added a tiny bit of water and mixed it and he didnt notice. He is worm free!

customer_reviews.title: Panacur works!
customer_reviews.text: We use these are our small dogs to save money we split up one packet for 4-10 pound dogs. Works great!

customer_reviews.title: Product works great at deworming my rescue dogs
customer_reviews.text: Product works great at deworming my rescue dogs. I used as directed and repeated treatment every 3 weeks for a total of 3 separate treatments. My dogs went back into the vet and tested negative for all parasites.

customer_reviews.text: Worked great, trusty product. Bought for older Dalmatian. Never saw any side effects. Have used this product for years and this is the best price I have seen.

customer_reviews.text: Good price and it does what it is supposed to do.

customer_reviews.title: giardia treatment
customer_reviews.text: I did two rounds of this de wormer as recommended by the Great Dane lady to treat Giardia after we were unsuccessful with two rounds of antibiotics. It really did the trick. Use caution and be certain your dog is free of heart worm before starting panacur or it can be deadly. I also did probiotics in conjunction with this treatment to re colonize the gut as it really clears everything out!
customer_reviews.author: DC

product_meta.title: Panacur C Canine Dewormer (Fenbendazole), 4 Gram
product_meta.description: Panacur C (fenbendazole) Canine Dewormer is for the treatment and control of Roundworms, Hookworms, Whipworms and Taenia Tapeworms in Dogs. Panacur C treats all 4 major intestinal parasites in dogs. The daily dose for Panacur C is 50 mg/kg (22.7 mg/lb) of body weight. Consult your veterinarian for assistance in the diagnosis, treatment and control of parasitism. Approximately 1% of dogs had vomiting associated with the use of this product. Panacur C Canine Dewormer has no known interactions.
feature_bullets: Mix the daily dose with a small amount of your dog’s usual food. Your dog should eat all of the medicated food. If feeding dry dog food, it may need to be moistened to aid mixing
Repeat the daily dose for 3 days in a row (each packet is a daily dose depending on your dog's size)
If dog's weight is in-between suggested dosing sizes, it's safe to use the next higher size. For example a a 15 pound dog should be treated with the 2gm packet
Safe for all dogs 6 weeks and older, including pregnant dogs
Deworming schedules may vary depending on the climate where you live and the activity of your dog
